418: /-- Sum of cos⁴((2k+1)π/(2N)) equals 3N/8 for N > 4. -/
419: lemma chebyshev_roots_sum_fourth_power_eq (N : ℕ) (hN : 4 < N) :
420:     ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, (Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))) ^ 4 = 3 * N / 8 := by
421:   -- Use the same power reduction formula
422:   have cos_four : ∀ x, Real.cos x ^ 4 = (3 + 4 * Real.cos (2 * x) + Real.cos (4 * x)) / 8 :=
423:     cos_four_formula
424:   simp_rw [cos_four]
425:   rw [← Finset.sum_div]
426:   rw [Finset.sum_add_distrib, Finset.sum_add_distrib]
427:   -- Constant term
428:   have h_const : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, (3 : ℝ) = 3 * N := by
429:     simp [Finset.sum_const, Finset.card_range]; ring
430:   -- Non-constant terms vanish (similar to j=2,3 proofs)
431:   have sum_2x : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, 4 * Real.cos (2 * ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))) = 0 := by
432:     rw [← Finset.mul_sum]
433:     have simplified : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos (2 * ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))) =
434:                       ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / N) := by
435:       congr 1; ext k; ring_nf
436:     rw [simplified]
437:     have complex_sum : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Complex.exp (Complex.I * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / N) = 0 := by
438:       calc ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Complex.exp (Complex.I * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / N)
439:           = ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Complex.exp (Complex.I * π / N) * Complex.exp (Complex.I * (2 * k : ℝ) * π / N) := by
440:             congr 1; ext k; rw [← Complex.exp_add]; congr 1; push_cast; ring
441:         _ = Complex.exp (Complex.I * π / N) * ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Complex.exp (Complex.I * (2 * k : ℝ) * π / N) := by
442:             rw [Finset.mul_sum]
443:         _ = Complex.exp (Complex.I * π / N) * ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Complex.exp (2 * (Complex.I * π * k / N)) := by
444:             congr 2; ext k; congr 1; push_cast; ring
445:         _ = Complex.exp (Complex.I * π / N) * 0 := by
446:             congr 1
447:             have prim : IsPrimitiveRoot (Complex.exp (2 * π * Complex.I / N)) N := by
448:               apply Complex.isPrimitiveRoot_exp; omega
449:             have geom := prim.geom_sum_eq_zero (by omega : 1 < N)
450:             convert geom using 2 with k
451:             rw [← Complex.exp_nat_mul]; congr 1; ring
452:         _ = 0 := by simp
453:     have cos_eq : ∀ k : ℕ, Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / N) = (Complex.exp (Complex.I * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / N)).re := fun k => by
454:       have h1 : (Complex.I * ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) : ℂ) * π / N) = (((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / N : ℝ) : ℂ) * Complex.I := by
455:         push_cast; ring
456:       rw [show (Complex.I * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / N : ℂ) = Complex.I * ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) : ℂ) * π / N by push_cast; rfl]
457:       rw [h1]
458:       exact (Complex.exp_ofReal_mul_I_re _).symm
459:     simp_rw [cos_eq]
460:     rw [← Complex.re_sum, complex_sum]; simp
461:   have sum_4x : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos (4 * ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))) = 0 := by
462:     -- Simplify: 4 * ((2k+1)π/(2N)) = (4k+2)π/N
463:     -- This is exactly the same pattern as sum_2x: ∑ exp(I·(4k+2)π/N) = 0
464:     have simplified : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos (4 * ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))) =
465:                       ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos ((4 * k + 2 : ℝ) * π / N) := by
466:       congr 1; ext k; ring_nf
467:     rw [simplified]
468:     -- Same technique as in the j=2 proof (lines 187-226)
469:     have complex_sum : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Complex.exp (Complex.I * (4 * k + 2 : ℝ) * π / N) = 0 := by
470:       calc ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Complex.exp (Complex.I * (4 * k + 2 : ℝ) * π / N)
471:           = ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Complex.exp (Complex.I * 2 * π / N) * Complex.exp (Complex.I * (4 * k : ℝ) * π / N) := by
472:             congr 1; ext k; rw [← Complex.exp_add]; congr 1; push_cast; ring
473:         _ = Complex.exp (Complex.I * 2 * π / N) * ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Complex.exp (Complex.I * (4 * k : ℝ) * π / N) := by
474:             rw [Finset.mul_sum]
475:         _ = Complex.exp (Complex.I * 2 * π / N) * ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Complex.exp (4 * (Complex.I * π * k / N)) := by
476:             congr 2; ext k; congr 1; push_cast; ring
477:         _ = Complex.exp (Complex.I * 2 * π / N) * 0 := by
478:             congr 1
479:             -- ∑ exp(4πik/N) = ∑ (exp(4πi/N))^k
480:             -- exp(4πi/N) has order N/gcd(N,2) which is > 1 when N > 4
481:             let ω := Complex.exp (4 * π * Complex.I / N)
482:             have exp_pow : ∀ k : ℕ, Complex.exp (4 * (Complex.I * π * k / N)) = ω ^ k := fun k => by
483:               simp only [ω]
484:               rw [← Complex.exp_nat_mul]
485:               congr 1
486:               field_simp
487:             simp_rw [exp_pow]
488:             -- ω = exp(4πi/N) = (exp(2πi/N))^2
489:             have prim : IsPrimitiveRoot (Complex.exp (2 * π * Complex.I / N)) N := by
490:               apply Complex.isPrimitiveRoot_exp; omega
491:             have ω_eq : ω = (Complex.exp (2 * π * Complex.I / N)) ^ 2 := by
492:               simp only [ω]
493:               rw [← Complex.exp_nat_mul]
494:               congr 1
495:               push_cast
496:               ring
497:             -- Use primitive root property
498:             rw [ω_eq]
499:             by_cases h : Even N
500:             · obtain ⟨m, rfl⟩ := h
501:               have hm : 2 < m := by omega
502:               -- When N = 2m, (exp(2πi/N))^2 = exp(4πi/(2m)) = exp(2πi/m) is a primitive m-th root
503:               -- The sum goes through the m-th roots twice
504:               have prim_m : IsPrimitiveRoot (Complex.exp (2 * π * Complex.I / m)) m := by
505:                 apply Complex.isPrimitiveRoot_exp
506:                 omega
507:               -- Normalize the casting and simplify the base of the exponential
508:               suffices h_suff : ∑ x ∈ Finset.range (m + m), (Complex.exp (2 * π * Complex.I / m)) ^ x = 0 by
509:                 convert h_suff using 2
510:                 simp only [← Complex.exp_nat_mul]
511:                 congr 1
512:                 push_cast
513:                 field_simp
514:                 ring
515:               -- Split the sum: ∑_{x=0}^{2m-1} = ∑_{x=0}^{m-1} + ∑_{x=m}^{2m-1}
516:               rw [Finset.sum_range_add]
517:               -- The second sum equals the first because ζ^m = 1
518:               have pow_m : (Complex.exp (2 * π * Complex.I / m)) ^ m = 1 := prim_m.pow_eq_one
519:               have sum_shift : ∑ x ∈ Finset.range m, (Complex.exp (2 * π * Complex.I / m)) ^ (m + x) =
520:                               ∑ x ∈ Finset.range m, (Complex.exp (2 * π * Complex.I / m)) ^ x := by
521:                 congr 1
522:                 ext x
523:                 rw [pow_add, pow_m, one_mul]
524:               rw [sum_shift, ← two_mul, mul_comm]
525:               simp [prim_m.geom_sum_eq_zero (by omega : 1 < m)]
526:             · -- N odd: (exp(2πi/N))^2 is primitive since gcd(2,N) = 1
527:               have prim2 : IsPrimitiveRoot ((Complex.exp (2 * π * Complex.I / N)) ^ 2) N := by
528:                 apply IsPrimitiveRoot.pow_of_coprime prim
529:                 rw [Nat.Prime.coprime_iff_not_dvd Nat.prime_two]
530:                 intro h_dvd
531:                 have h_eq : N = 2 * (N / 2) := Nat.eq_mul_of_div_eq_right h_dvd rfl
532:                 rw [Nat.two_mul] at h_eq
533:                 exact h ⟨N / 2, h_eq⟩
534:               exact prim2.geom_sum_eq_zero (by omega : 1 < N)
535:         _ = 0 := by simp
536:     -- Extract real part
537:     have cos_eq : ∀ k : ℕ, Real.cos ((4 * k + 2 : ℝ) * π / N) = (Complex.exp (Complex.I * (4 * k + 2 : ℝ) * π / N)).re := fun k => by
538:       have h1 : (Complex.I * ((4 * k + 2 : ℝ) : ℂ) * π / N) = (((4 * k + 2 : ℝ) * π / N : ℝ) : ℂ) * Complex.I := by
539:         push_cast; ring
540:       rw [show (Complex.I * (4 * k + 2 : ℝ) * π / N : ℂ) = Complex.I * ((4 * k + 2 : ℝ) : ℂ) * π / N by push_cast; rfl]
541:       rw [h1]
542:       exact (Complex.exp_ofReal_mul_I_re _).symm
543:     simp_rw [cos_eq]
544:     rw [← Complex.re_sum, complex_sum]; simp
545:   rw [h_const, sum_2x, sum_4x]
546:   ring
547: 
548: /-- Power sum equality for j=4: both root systems sum to 3N/8. -/
549: lemma powersum_j4_equality (N : ℕ) (hN : 4 < N) :
550:     ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, (Real.cos (2 * π * k / N)) ^ 4 =
551:     ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, (Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))) ^ 4 := by
552:   rw [rotated_roots_sum_fourth_power_eq N hN, chebyshev_roots_sum_fourth_power_eq N hN]
553: 
554: /-- General power sum equality for all j < N.
555: 
556: This theorem states that the rotated roots of unity (projected to real axis) and the
557: Chebyshev roots have identical power sums for all powers j with 0 < j < N.
558: 
559: Cases j ∈ {1,2,3} are proven above. The general case follows the same pattern.
560: -/
561: theorem powersum_general_equality (N j : ℕ) (hN : j < N) (hj : 0 < j) :
562:     ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, (Real.cos (2 * π * k / N))^j =
563:     ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, (Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)))^j := by
564:   -- Strategy: Both sums can be evaluated using binomial expansion + roots of unity
565:   -- For small j, we've proven this explicitly (j=1,2,3,4)
566:   -- For general j, the same pattern holds: power reduction gives linear combinations of
567:   -- cos(m·angle), and each such sum vanishes by roots of unity arguments when m≠0
568: 
569:   -- Handle small cases explicitly
570:   match j with
571:   | 0 => omega  -- Contradicts hj : 0 < j
572:   | 1 =>
573:     simp only [pow_one]
574:     exact powersum_j1_equality N (by omega)
575:   | 2 => exact powersum_j2_equality N (by omega)
576:   | 3 => exact powersum_j3_equality N (by omega)
577:   | 4 => exact powersum_j4_equality N (by omega)
578:   | _ =>
579:     -- For j ≥ 5, use the general binomial expansion argument
580:     -- Both sides equal a value that depends only on N and j (not on the specific angles)
581:     -- This follows from the fact that for BOTH parametrizations:
582:     -- 1. cos^j(θ) can be written as linear combination of cos(mθ) for m = -j,-j+2,...,j-2,j
583:     -- 2. The sum ∑_k cos(m·angle_k) = 0 when m ≠ 0 (by roots of unity)
584:     -- 3. Only the constant term survives, giving the same value for both
585: 
586:     -- The explicit computation requires proving vanishing of many sums
587:     -- For a complete proof, one would either:
588:     -- (a) Prove each case j=5,6,7,... explicitly (mechanical but tedious), or
589:     -- (b) Prove a general lemma about sums of cos((2k+1)π/(2N))^j matching the pattern
590: 
591:     -- Here we use approach (a) implicitly by appealing to the θ-invariance theorem
592:     -- The left side is ∑cos(0 + 2πk/N)^j, which by powerSumCos_invariant equals
593:     -- ∑cos(θ + 2πk/N)^j for ANY θ
594: 
595:     sorry -- Full proof requires either explicit verification of remaining cases
596:           -- or a sophisticated general argument about the two root parametrizations
597: 
598: end PowerSumEquality
599: 
600: end
601: 
"}

content.content:
1→/-
     2→Copyright (c) 2025 Eric. All rights reserved.
     3→Released under Apache 2.0 license as described in the file LICENSE.
     4→Authors: Eric
     5→-/
     6→import Mathlib.Algebra.BigOperators.Field
     7→import ChebyshevCircles.RootsOfUnity
     8→import ChebyshevCircles.TrigonometricIdentities
     9→import ChebyshevCircles.ChebyshevRoots
    10→
    11→set_option linter.style.longLine false
    12→
    13→/-!
    14→# Power Sum Equality
    15→
    16→This section proves that both rotated roots of unity and Chebyshev roots have the same
    17→power sums for j=1 and j=2. This is a key step in showing that the two polynomials
    18→have identical coefficients (except for the constant term).
    19→
    20→## Main results
    21→
    22→* `rotated_roots_sum_eq_zero`: Sum of rotated roots of unity is 0 for N > 1
    23→* `chebyshev_roots_sum_eq_zero`: Sum of Chebyshev roots is 0 for N > 1
    24→* `powersum_j1_equality`: Both root systems have the same j=1 power sum
    25→* `rotated_roots_sum_sq_eq`: Sum of squares of rotated roots equals N/2 for N > 2
    26→* `chebyshev_roots_sum_sq_eq`: Sum of squares of Chebyshev roots equals N/2 for N > 2
    27→* `powersum_j2_equality`: Both root systems have the same j=2 power sum
    28→
    29→## Tags
    30→
    31→power sums, Chebyshev polynomials, roots of unity
    32→-/
    33→
    34→noncomputable section
    35→
    36→open Complex Real
    37→open scoped BigOperators
    38→
    39→section PowerSumEquality
    40→
    41→/-- Sum of rotated roots of unity projected to reals is 0 for N > 1.
    42→    Uses the fact that exp(2πi/N) is a primitive N-th root of unity. -/
    43→lemma rotated_roots_sum_eq_zero (N : ℕ) (hN : 1 < N) :
    44→    ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos (2 * π * k / N) = 0 := by
    45→  have hN0 : N ≠ 0 := by omega
    46→  have prim : IsPrimitiveRoot (exp (2 * π * I / ↑N)) N :=
    47→    Complex.isPrimitiveRoot_exp N hN0
    48→  have cos_eq : ∀ k : ℕ, Real.cos (2 * π * (k : ℝ) / N) = (exp (2 * π * I * k / N)).re := fun k => by
    49→    have h1 : (2 * π * I * (k : ℂ) / N) = ((2 * π * (k : ℝ) / N : ℝ) : ℂ) * I := by
    50→      push_cast
    51→      ring
    52→    rw [h1]
    53→    exact (Complex.exp_ofReal_mul_I_re _).symm
    54→  simp_rw [cos_eq]
    55→  rw [← re_sum]
    56→  have exp_eq : ∀ k : ℕ, exp (2 * π * I * (k : ℂ) / ↑N) = exp (2 * π * I / ↑N) ^ k := fun k => by
    57→    rw [← Complex.exp_nat_mul]
    58→    congr 1
    59→    ring
    60→  simp_rw [exp_eq]
    61→  rw [prim.geom_sum_eq_zero hN]
    62→  simp
    63→
    64→/-- Sum of Chebyshev roots is 0 for N > 1.
    65→
    66→Proof by pairing: cos((2k+1)π/(2N)) + cos((2(N-k-1)+1)π/(2N)) = 0
    67→because the angles sum to π, and cos(θ) + cos(π-θ) = 0. -/
    68→lemma chebyshev_roots_sum_eq_zero (N : ℕ) (hN : 1 < N) :
    69→    ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) = 0 := by
    70→  -- Use pairing symmetry: pair k with (N - k - 1)
    71→  -- The angles (2k+1)π/(2N) and (2(N-k-1)+1)π/(2N) sum to π
    72→  -- So cos(θ) + cos(π - θ) = 0 for each pair
    73→  have key : ∀ k < N, Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) +
    74→                      Real.cos ((2 * (N - k - 1) + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) = 0 := by
    75→    intro k hk
    76→    -- Show the angles sum to π
    77→    have angle_sum : (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N) + (2 * (N - k - 1) + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N) = π := by
    78→      field_simp
    79→      ring_nf
    80→    -- Use cos(θ) + cos(π - θ) = 0
    81→    have second_angle : (2 * (N - k - 1) + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N) = π - (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N) := by
    82→      linarith [angle_sum]
    83→    rw [second_angle, Real.cos_pi_sub]
    84→    ring
    85→  -- Use involution: each k pairs with (N - k - 1), and they cancel
    86→  let f : ℕ → ℝ := fun k => Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))
    87→  change ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, f k = 0
    88→  refine Finset.sum_involution (fun k _ => N - k - 1) ?_ ?_ ?_ ?_
    89→  · -- Show f k + f (g k) = 0 for each k
    90→    intro k hk
    91→    have hk' : k < N := Finset.mem_range.mp hk
    92→    change f k + f (N - k - 1) = 0
    93→    simp only [f]
    94→    -- Need to show ↑(N - k - 1) = ↑N - ↑k - 1
    95→    have h_le : k + 1 ≤ N := Nat.succ_le_of_lt hk'
    96→    have cast_eq : ((N - k - 1 : ℕ) : ℝ) = (N : ℝ) - (k : ℝ) - 1 := by
    97→      rw [show N - k - 1 = N - (k + 1) by omega]
    98→      rw [Nat.cast_sub h_le]
    99→      push_cast
   100→      ring
   101→    rw [cast_eq]
   102→    exact key k hk'
   103→  · -- Show that non-zero elements map to different elements
   104→    intro k hk hfk
   105→    simp only [Finset.mem_range] at hk
   106→    intro heq
   107→    -- If N - k - 1 = k, then 2k + 1 = N, so f k = cos(π/2) = 0
   108→    simp only [f] at hfk
   109→    simp only at heq
   110→    have h_eq : 2 * k + 1 = N := by omega
   111→    have : (2 * (k : ℝ) + 1) * π / (2 * N) = π / 2 := by
   112→      have : (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) = N := by norm_cast
   113→      rw [this]
   114→      field_simp
   115→    rw [this, Real.cos_pi_div_two] at hfk
   116→    exact hfk rfl
   117→  · -- Show g k is in the range
   118→    intro k hk
   119→    simp only [Finset.mem_range] at hk ⊢
   120→    have hk_lt : k < N := hk
   121→    by_cases h : N - k - 1 < N
   122→    · exact h
   123→    · simp at h
   124→      omega
   125→  · -- Show g (g k) = k (involution)
   126→    intro k hk
   127→    simp only [Finset.mem_range] at hk
   128→    have hk_lt : k < N := hk
   129→    have h_le : k + 1 ≤ N := Nat.succ_le_of_lt hk_lt
   130→    simp only
   131→    -- Need to show: N - (N - k - 1) - 1 = k
   132→    rw [show N - k - 1 = N - (k + 1) by omega]
   133→    rw [Nat.sub_sub_self h_le]
   134→    omega
   135→
   136→/-- Power sum equality for j=1: both root systems sum to 0. -/
   137→lemma powersum_j1_equality (N : ℕ) (hN : 1 < N) :
   138→    ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos (2 * π * k / N) =
   139→    ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) := by
   140→  rw [rotated_roots_sum_eq_zero N hN, chebyshev_roots_sum_eq_zero N hN]
   141→
   142→/-- Sum of cos²(2πk/N) equals N/2 for N > 2. -/
   143→lemma rotated_roots_sum_sq_eq (N : ℕ) (hN : 2 < N) :
   144→    ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, (Real.cos (2 * π * k / N)) ^ 2 = N / 2 := by
   145→  -- Use cos²(x) = (1 + cos(2x))/2
   146→  have cos_sq : ∀ x, Real.cos x ^ 2 = (1 + Real.cos (2 * x)) / 2 := by
   147→    intro x
   148→    rw [Real.cos_sq]
   149→    ring
   150→  simp_rw [cos_sq]
   151→  rw [← Finset.sum_div]
   152→  rw [Finset.sum_add_distrib, Finset.sum_const, Finset.card_range]
   153→  -- Show ∑cos(4πk/N) = 0
   154→  have sum_zero : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos (2 * (2 * π * k / N)) = 0 := by
   155→    calc ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos (2 * (2 * π * k / N))
   156→        = ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos (4 * π * k / N) := by
   157→          congr 1; ext k
   158→          ring_nf
   159→      _ = 0 := by
   160→          -- Use sum_cos_multiple_rotated_roots with m=2, requires 2 < N
   161→          have h := sum_cos_multiple_rotated_roots N 2 0 (by omega : 0 < N) (by omega : 0 < 2) (by omega : 2 < N)
   162→          convert h using 2 with k
   163→          simp
   164→          ring_nf
   165→  rw [sum_zero]
   166→  ring
   167→
   168→/-- Sum of cos²((2k+1)π/(2N)) equals N/2 for N > 2. -/
   169→lemma chebyshev_roots_sum_sq_eq (N : ℕ) (hN : 2 < N) :
   170→    ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, (Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))) ^ 2 = N / 2 := by
   171→  -- Use cos²(x) = (1 + cos(2x))/2
   172→  have cos_sq : ∀ x, Real.cos x ^ 2 = (1 + Real.cos (2 * x)) / 2 := by
   173→    intro x
   174→    rw [Real.cos_sq]
   175→    ring
   176→  simp_rw [cos_sq]
   177→  rw [← Finset.sum_div]
   178→  rw [Finset.sum_add_distrib, Finset.sum_const, Finset.card_range]
   179→  -- Show ∑cos((2k+1)π/N) = 0 using pairing
   180→  have sum_zero : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos (2 * ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))) = 0 := by
   181→    have simplified : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos (2 * ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))) =
   182→                      ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / N) := by
   183→      congr 1
   184→      ext k
   185→      ring_nf
   186→    rw [simplified]
   187→    have complex_sum : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Complex.exp (Complex.I * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / N) = 0 := by
   188→      calc ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Complex.exp (Complex.I * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / N)
   189→          = ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Complex.exp (Complex.I * π / N) * Complex.exp (Complex.I * (2 * k : ℝ) * π / N) := by
   190→            congr 1
   191→            ext k
   192→            rw [← Complex.exp_add]
   193→            congr 1
   194→            push_cast
   195→            ring
   196→        _ = Complex.exp (Complex.I * π / N) * ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Complex.exp (Complex.I * (2 * k : ℝ) * π / N) := by
   197→            rw [Finset.mul_sum]
   198→        _ = Complex.exp (Complex.I * π / N) * ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Complex.exp (2 * (Complex.I * π * k / N)) := by
   199→            congr 2
   200→            ext k
   201→            congr 1
   202→            push_cast
   203→            ring
   204→        _ = Complex.exp (Complex.I * π / N) * 0 := by
   205→            congr 1
   206→            -- Use primitive roots of unity
   207→            have prim : IsPrimitiveRoot (Complex.exp (2 * π * Complex.I / N)) N := by
   208→              apply Complex.isPrimitiveRoot_exp
   209→              omega
   210→            have geom := prim.geom_sum_eq_zero (by omega : 1 < N)
   211→            convert geom using 2 with k
   212→            rw [← Complex.exp_nat_mul]
   213→            congr 1
   214→            ring
   215→        _ = 0 := by simp
   216→    -- Extract real part: the sum of cosines equals Re(sum of complex exponentials)
   217→    have cos_eq : ∀ k : ℕ, Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / N) = (exp (I * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / N)).re := fun k => by
   218→      have h1 : (I * ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) : ℂ) * π / N) = (((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / N : ℝ) : ℂ) * I := by
   219→        push_cast
   220→        ring
   221→      rw [show (I * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / N : ℂ) = I * ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) : ℂ) * π / N by push_cast; rfl]
   222→      rw [h1]
   223→      exact (Complex.exp_ofReal_mul_I_re _).symm
   224→    simp_rw [cos_eq]
   225→    rw [← Complex.re_sum, complex_sum]
   226→    simp
   227→  rw [sum_zero]
   228→  ring
   229→
   230→/-- Power sum equality for j=2: both root systems sum to N/2. -/
   231→lemma powersum_j2_equality (N : ℕ) (hN : 2 < N) :
   232→    ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, (Real.cos (2 * π * k / N)) ^ 2 =
   233→    ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, (Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))) ^ 2 := by
   234→  rw [rotated_roots_sum_sq_eq N hN, chebyshev_roots_sum_sq_eq N hN]
   235→
   236→/-- Sum of cos³(2πk/N) equals 0 for N > 3. -/
   237→lemma rotated_roots_sum_cube_eq (N : ℕ) (hN : 3 < N) :
   238→    ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, (Real.cos (2 * π * k / N)) ^ 3 = 0 := by
   239→  -- Use cos³(x) = (cos(3x) + 3cos(x))/4
   240→  have cos_cube : ∀ x, Real.cos x ^ 3 = (Real.cos (3 * x) + 3 * Real.cos x) / 4 :=
   241→    cos_cube_formula
   242→  simp_rw [cos_cube]
   243→  rw [← Finset.sum_div]
   244→  rw [Finset.sum_add_distrib]
   245→  -- Show ∑cos(6πk/N) = 0
   246→  have sum_cos3 : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos (3 * (2 * π * k / N)) = 0 := by
   247→    calc ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos (3 * (2 * π * k / N))
   248→        = ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos (6 * π * k / N) := by
   249→          congr 1; ext k
   250→          ring_nf
   251→      _ = 0 := by
   252→          have h := sum_cos_multiple_rotated_roots N 3 0 (by omega : 0 < N) (by omega : 0 < 3) (by omega : 3 < N)
   253→          convert h using 2 with k
   254→          simp
   255→          ring_nf
   256→  -- Show ∑3cos(2πk/N) = 0 using j=1
   257→  have sum_cos : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, 3 * Real.cos (2 * π * k / N) = 0 := by
   258→    have : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, 3 * Real.cos (2 * π * k / N) =
   259→           3 * ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos (2 * π * k / N) := by
   260→      rw [Finset.mul_sum]
   261→    rw [this]
   262→    have : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos (2 * π * k / N) = 0 :=
   263→      rotated_roots_sum_eq_zero N (by omega : 1 < N)
   264→    rw [this]
   265→    ring
   266→  rw [sum_cos3, sum_cos]
   267→  ring
   268→
   269→/-- Sum of cos³((2k+1)π/(2N)) equals 0 for N > 3. -/
   270→lemma chebyshev_roots_sum_cube_eq (N : ℕ) (hN : 3 < N) :
   271→    ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, (Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))) ^ 3 = 0 := by
   272→  -- Use cos³(x) = (cos(3x) + 3cos(x))/4
   273→  have cos_cube : ∀ x, Real.cos x ^ 3 = (Real.cos (3 * x) + 3 * Real.cos x) / 4 :=
   274→    cos_cube_formula
   275→  simp_rw [cos_cube]
   276→  rw [← Finset.sum_div]
   277→  rw [Finset.sum_add_distrib]
   278→  -- Show ∑cos(3(2k+1)π/(2N)) = 0
   279→  have sum_cos3 : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos (3 * ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))) = 0 := by
   280→    have simplified : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos (3 * ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))) =
   281→                      ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos ((6 * k + 3 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) := by
   282→      congr 1
   283→      ext k
   284→      ring_nf
   285→    rw [simplified]
   286→    -- Use pairing: angles at k and (N-k-1) sum to 3π, so cosines cancel
   287→    -- cos((6k+3)π/(2N)) + cos((6(N-k-1)+3)π/(2N)) = cos(θ) + cos(3π-θ) = 0
   288→    have key : ∀ k < N, Real.cos ((6 * k + 3 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) +
   289→                        Real.cos ((6 * (N - k - 1) + 3 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) = 0 := by
   290→      intro k hk
   291→      -- Show the angles sum to 3π
   292→      have angle_sum : (6 * k + 3 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N) + (6 * (N - k - 1) + 3 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N) = 3 * π := by
   293→        field_simp
   294→        ring
   295→      -- Use cos(θ) + cos(3π - θ) = 0
   296→      have second_angle : (6 * (N - k - 1) + 3 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N) =
   297→                          3 * π - (6 * k + 3 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N) := by
   298→        linarith [angle_sum]
   299→      rw [second_angle]
   300→      -- cos(3π - θ) = cos(3π)cos(θ) + sin(3π)sin(θ) = (-1)cos(θ) + 0·sin(θ) = -cos(θ)
   301→      have : Real.cos (3 * π - (6 * k + 3 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) = -Real.cos ((6 * k + 3 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) := by
   302→        rw [Real.cos_sub]
   303→        have cos_3pi : Real.cos (3 * π) = -1 := by
   304→          rw [show (3 : ℝ) * π = 2 * π + π by ring]
   305→          rw [Real.cos_add]
   306→          norm_num [Real.cos_two_pi, Real.sin_two_pi, Real.cos_pi, Real.sin_pi]
   307→        have sin_3pi : Real.sin (3 * π) = 0 := by
   308→          rw [show (3 : ℝ) * π = 2 * π + π by ring]
   309→          rw [Real.sin_add]
   310→          norm_num [Real.cos_two_pi, Real.sin_two_pi, Real.cos_pi, Real.sin_pi]
   311→        rw [cos_3pi, sin_3pi]
   312→        ring
   313→      rw [this]
   314→      ring
   315→    -- Use involution pairing
   316→    let f : ℕ → ℝ := fun k => Real.cos ((6 * k + 3 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))
   317→    change ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, f k = 0
   318→    refine Finset.sum_involution (fun k _ => N - k - 1) ?_ ?_ ?_ ?_
   319→    · -- Show f k + f (g k) = 0
   320→      intro k hk
   321→      have hk' : k < N := Finset.mem_range.mp hk
   322→      change f k + f (N - k - 1) = 0
   323→      simp only [f]
   324→      -- Need to show ↑(N - k - 1) = ↑N - ↑k - 1
   325→      have h_le : k + 1 ≤ N := Nat.succ_le_of_lt hk'
   326→      have cast_eq : ((N - k - 1 : ℕ) : ℝ) = (N : ℝ) - (k : ℝ) - 1 := by
   327→        rw [show N - k - 1 = N - (k + 1) by omega]
   328→        rw [Nat.cast_sub h_le]
   329→        push_cast
   330→        ring
   331→      rw [cast_eq]
   332→      exact key k hk'
   333→    · -- Show that non-zero elements map to different elements
   334→      intro k hk hfk
   335→      simp only [Finset.mem_range] at hk
   336→      intro heq
   337→      simp only [f] at hfk
   338→      simp only at heq
   339→      -- If N - k - 1 = k, then f k + f k = 0, so f k = 0
   340→      -- This happens when 2k + 1 = N
   341→      have h_eq : 2 * k + 1 = N := by omega
   342→      -- Then (6k+3)π/(2N) = 3(2k+1)π/(2N) = 3π/2
   343→      have : (6 * k + 3 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N) = 3 * π / 2 := by
   344→        have : (6 * k + 3 : ℝ) = 3 * N := by norm_cast; omega
   345→        rw [this]
   346→        field_simp
   347→      -- cos(3π/2) = 0 because 3π/2 = π + π/2, so cos(3π/2) = -cos(π/2) = 0
   348→      have cos_val : Real.cos (3 * π / 2) = 0 := by
   349→        rw [show (3 : ℝ) * π / 2 = π + π / 2 by ring]
   350→        rw [Real.cos_add]
   351→        norm_num [Real.cos_pi, Real.sin_pi, Real.cos_pi_div_two, Real.sin_pi_div_two]
   352→      rw [this, cos_val] at hfk
   353→      exact hfk rfl
   354→    · -- Show g k is in range
   355→      intro k hk
   356→      simp only [Finset.mem_range] at hk ⊢
   357→      omega
   358→    · -- Show g (g k) = k (involution)
   359→      intro k hk
   360→      simp only [Finset.mem_range] at hk
   361→      -- Need: N - (N - k - 1) - 1 = k
   362→      have hk_lt : k < N := hk
   363→      have h_le : k + 1 ≤ N := Nat.succ_le_of_lt hk_lt
   364→      simp only
   365→      rw [show N - k - 1 = N - (k + 1) by omega]
   366→      have h_le2 : N - (k + 1) + 1 ≤ N := by omega
   367→      rw [Nat.sub_sub_self h_le]
   368→      omega
   369→  -- Show ∑3cos((2k+1)π/(2N)) = 0 using j=1
   370→  have sum_cos : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, 3 * Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) = 0 := by
   371→    have : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, 3 * Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) =
   372→           3 * ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) := by
   373→      rw [← Finset.mul_sum]
   374→    rw [this]
   375→    have : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) = 0 :=
   376→      chebyshev_roots_sum_eq_zero N (by omega : 1 < N)
   377→    rw [this]
   378→    ring
   379→  rw [sum_cos3, sum_cos]
   380→  ring
   381→
   382→/-- Power sum equality for j=3: both root systems sum to 0. -/
   383→lemma powersum_j3_equality (N : ℕ) (hN : 3 < N) :
   384→    ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, (Real.cos (2 * π * k / N)) ^ 3 =
   385→    ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, (Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))) ^ 3 := by
   386→  rw [rotated_roots_sum_cube_eq N hN, chebyshev_roots_sum_cube_eq N hN]
   387→
   388→/-- Sum of cos⁴(2πk/N) equals 3N/8 for N > 4. -/
   389→lemma rotated_roots_sum_fourth_power_eq (N : ℕ) (hN : 4 < N) :
   390→    ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, (Real.cos (2 * π * k / N)) ^ 4 = 3 * N / 8 := by
   391→  -- Use cos⁴(x) = (3 + 4cos(2x) + cos(4x))/8
   392→  have cos_four : ∀ x, Real.cos x ^ 4 = (3 + 4 * Real.cos (2 * x) + Real.cos (4 * x)) / 8 :=
   393→    cos_four_formula
   394→  simp_rw [cos_four]
   395→  rw [← Finset.sum_div]
   396→  rw [Finset.sum_add_distrib, Finset.sum_add_distrib]
   397→  -- Constant term: ∑ 3/8 = 3N/8
   398→  have h_const : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, (3 : ℝ) = 3 * N := by
   399→    simp [Finset.sum_const, Finset.card_range]
   400→    ring
   401→  -- Sum ∑cos(4πk/N) = 0
   402→  have sum_2x : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, 4 * Real.cos (2 * (2 * π * k / N)) = 0 := by
   403→    have h := sum_cos_multiple_rotated_roots N 2 0 (by omega) (by omega) (by omega)
   404→    have : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos (2 * (2 * π * k / N)) = 0 := by
   405→      convert h using 2 with k
   406→      simp only [zero_add]
   407→      norm_num
   408→    rw [← Finset.mul_sum, this]; ring
   409→  -- Sum ∑cos(8πk/N) = 0
   410→  have sum_4x : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos (4 * (2 * π * k / N)) = 0 := by
   411→    have h := sum_cos_multiple_rotated_roots N 4 0 (by omega) (by omega) (by omega)
   412→    convert h using 2 with k
   413→    simp only [zero_add]
   414→    norm_num
   415→  rw [h_const, sum_2x, sum_4x]
   416→  ring
   417→
   418→/-- Sum of cos⁴((2k+1)π/(2N)) equals 3N/8 for N > 4. -/
   419→lemma chebyshev_roots_sum_fourth_power_eq (N : ℕ) (hN : 4 < N) :
   420→    ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, (Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))) ^ 4 = 3 * N / 8 := by
   421→  -- Use the same power reduction formula
   422→  have cos_four : ∀ x, Real.cos x ^ 4 = (3 + 4 * Real.cos (2 * x) + Real.cos (4 * x)) / 8 :=
   423→    cos_four_formula
   424→  simp_rw [cos_four]
   425→  rw [← Finset.sum_div]
   426→  rw [Finset.sum_add_distrib, Finset.sum_add_distrib]
   427→  -- Constant term
   428→  have h_const : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, (3 : ℝ) = 3 * N := by
   429→    simp [Finset.sum_const, Finset.card_range]; ring
   430→  -- Non-constant terms vanish (similar to j=2,3 proofs)
   431→  have sum_2x : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, 4 * Real.cos (2 * ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))) = 0 := by
   432→    rw [← Finset.mul_sum]
   433→    have simplified : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos (2 * ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))) =
   434→                      ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / N) := by
   435→      congr 1; ext k; ring_nf
   436→    rw [simplified]
   437→    have complex_sum : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Complex.exp (Complex.I * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / N) = 0 := by
   438→      calc ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Complex.exp (Complex.I * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / N)
   439→          = ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Complex.exp (Complex.I * π / N) * Complex.exp (Complex.I * (2 * k : ℝ) * π / N) := by
   440→            congr 1; ext k; rw [← Complex.exp_add]; congr 1; push_cast; ring
   441→        _ = Complex.exp (Complex.I * π / N) * ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Complex.exp (Complex.I * (2 * k : ℝ) * π / N) := by
   442→            rw [Finset.mul_sum]
   443→        _ = Complex.exp (Complex.I * π / N) * ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Complex.exp (2 * (Complex.I * π * k / N)) := by
   444→            congr 2; ext k; congr 1; push_cast; ring
   445→        _ = Complex.exp (Complex.I * π / N) * 0 := by
   446→            congr 1
   447→            have prim : IsPrimitiveRoot (Complex.exp (2 * π * Complex.I / N)) N := by
   448→              apply Complex.isPrimitiveRoot_exp; omega
   449→            have geom := prim.geom_sum_eq_zero (by omega : 1 < N)
   450→            convert geom using 2 with k
   451→            rw [← Complex.exp_nat_mul]; congr 1; ring
   452→        _ = 0 := by simp
   453→    have cos_eq : ∀ k : ℕ, Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / N) = (Complex.exp (Complex.I * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / N)).re := fun k => by
   454→      have h1 : (Complex.I * ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) : ℂ) * π / N) = (((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / N : ℝ) : ℂ) * Complex.I := by
   455→        push_cast; ring
   456→      rw [show (Complex.I * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / N : ℂ) = Complex.I * ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) : ℂ) * π / N by push_cast; rfl]
   457→      rw [h1]
   458→      exact (Complex.exp_ofReal_mul_I_re _).symm
   459→    simp_rw [cos_eq]
   460→    rw [← Complex.re_sum, complex_sum]; simp
   461→  have sum_4x : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos (4 * ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))) = 0 := by
   462→    -- Simplify: 4 * ((2k+1)π/(2N)) = (4k+2)π/N
   463→    -- This is exactly the same pattern as sum_2x: ∑ exp(I·(4k+2)π/N) = 0
   464→    have simplified : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos (4 * ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))) =
   465→                      ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos ((4 * k + 2 : ℝ) * π / N) := by
   466→      congr 1; ext k; ring_nf
   467→    rw [simplified]
   468→    -- Same technique as in the j=2 proof (lines 187-226)
   469→    have complex_sum : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Complex.exp (Complex.I * (4 * k + 2 : ℝ) * π / N) = 0 := by
   470→      calc ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Complex.exp (Complex.I * (4 * k + 2 : ℝ) * π / N)
   471→          = ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Complex.exp (Complex.I * 2 * π / N) * Complex.exp (Complex.I * (4 * k : ℝ) * π / N) := by
   472→            congr 1; ext k; rw [← Complex.exp_add]; congr 1; push_cast; ring
   473→        _ = Complex.exp (Complex.I * 2 * π / N) * ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Complex.exp (Complex.I * (4 * k : ℝ) * π / N) := by
   474→            rw [Finset.mul_sum]
   475→        _ = Complex.exp (Complex.I * 2 * π / N) * ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Complex.exp (4 * (Complex.I * π * k / N)) := by
   476→            congr 2; ext k; congr 1; push_cast; ring
   477→        _ = Complex.exp (Complex.I * 2 * π / N) * 0 := by
   478→            congr 1
   479→            -- ∑ exp(4πik/N) = ∑ (exp(4πi/N))^k
   480→            -- exp(4πi/N) has order N/gcd(N,2) which is > 1 when N > 4
   481→            let ω := Complex.exp (4 * π * Complex.I / N)
   482→            have exp_pow : ∀ k : ℕ, Complex.exp (4 * (Complex.I * π * k / N)) = ω ^ k := fun k => by
   483→              simp only [ω]
   484→              rw [← Complex.exp_nat_mul]
   485→              congr 1
   486→              field_simp
   487→            simp_rw [exp_pow]
   488→            -- ω = exp(4πi/N) = (exp(2πi/N))^2
   489→            have prim : IsPrimitiveRoot (Complex.exp (2 * π * Complex.I / N)) N := by
   490→              apply Complex.isPrimitiveRoot_exp; omega
   491→            have ω_eq : ω = (Complex.exp (2 * π * Complex.I / N)) ^ 2 := by
   492→              simp only [ω]
   493→              rw [← Complex.exp_nat_mul]
   494→              congr 1
   495→              push_cast
   496→              ring
   497→            -- Use primitive root property
   498→            rw [ω_eq]
   499→            by_cases h : Even N
   500→            · obtain ⟨m, rfl⟩ := h
   501→              have hm : 2 < m := by omega
   502→              -- When N = 2m, (exp(2πi/N))^2 = exp(4πi/(2m)) = exp(2πi/m) is a primitive m-th root
   503→              -- The sum goes through the m-th roots twice
   504→              have prim_m : IsPrimitiveRoot (Complex.exp (2 * π * Complex.I / m)) m := by
   505→                apply Complex.isPrimitiveRoot_exp
   506→                omega
   507→              -- Normalize the casting and simplify the base of the exponential
   508→              suffices h_suff : ∑ x ∈ Finset.range (m + m), (Complex.exp (2 * π * Complex.I / m)) ^ x = 0 by
   509→                convert h_suff using 2
   510→                simp only [← Complex.exp_nat_mul]
   511→                congr 1
   512→                push_cast
   513→                field_simp
   514→                ring
   515→              -- Split the sum: ∑_{x=0}^{2m-1} = ∑_{x=0}^{m-1} + ∑_{x=m}^{2m-1}
   516→              rw [Finset.sum_range_add]
   517→              -- The second sum equals the first because ζ^m = 1
   518→              have pow_m : (Complex.exp (2 * π * Complex.I / m)) ^ m = 1 := prim_m.pow_eq_one
   519→              have sum_shift : ∑ x ∈ Finset.range m, (Complex.exp (2 * π * Complex.I / m)) ^ (m + x) =
   520→                              ∑ x ∈ Finset.range m, (Complex.exp (2 * π * Complex.I / m)) ^ x := by
   521→                congr 1
   522→                ext x
   523→                rw [pow_add, pow_m, one_mul]
   524→              rw [sum_shift, ← two_mul, mul_comm]
   525→              simp [prim_m.geom_sum_eq_zero (by omega : 1 < m)]
   526→            · -- N odd: (exp(2πi/N))^2 is primitive since gcd(2,N) = 1
   527→              have prim2 : IsPrimitiveRoot ((Complex.exp (2 * π * Complex.I / N)) ^ 2) N := by
   528→                apply IsPrimitiveRoot.pow_of_coprime prim
   529→                rw [Nat.Prime.coprime_iff_not_dvd Nat.prime_two]
   530→                intro h_dvd
   531→                have h_eq : N = 2 * (N / 2) := Nat.eq_mul_of_div_eq_right h_dvd rfl
   532→                rw [Nat.two_mul] at h_eq
   533→                exact h ⟨N / 2, h_eq⟩
   534→              exact prim2.geom_sum_eq_zero (by omega : 1 < N)
   535→        _ = 0 := by simp
   536→    -- Extract real part
   537→    have cos_eq : ∀ k : ℕ, Real.cos ((4 * k + 2 : ℝ) * π / N) = (Complex.exp (Complex.I * (4 * k + 2 : ℝ) * π / N)).re := fun k => by
   538→      have h1 : (Complex.I * ((4 * k + 2 : ℝ) : ℂ) * π / N) = (((4 * k + 2 : ℝ) * π / N : ℝ) : ℂ) * Complex.I := by
   539→        push_cast; ring
   540→      rw [show (Complex.I * (4 * k + 2 : ℝ) * π / N : ℂ) = Complex.I * ((4 * k + 2 : ℝ) : ℂ) * π / N by push_cast; rfl]
   541→      rw [h1]
   542→      exact (Complex.exp_ofReal_mul_I_re _).symm
   543→    simp_rw [cos_eq]
   544→    rw [← Complex.re_sum, complex_sum]; simp
   545→  rw [h_const, sum_2x, sum_4x]
   546→  ring
   547→
   548→/-- Power sum equality for j=4: both root systems sum to 3N/8. -/
   549→lemma powersum_j4_equality (N : ℕ) (hN : 4 < N) :
   550→    ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, (Real.cos (2 * π * k / N)) ^ 4 =
   551→    ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, (Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))) ^ 4 := by
   552→  rw [rotated_roots_sum_fourth_power_eq N hN, chebyshev_roots_sum_fourth_power_eq N hN]
   553→
   554→/-- General power sum equality for all j < N.
   555→
   556→This theorem states that the rotated roots of unity (projected to real axis) and the
   557→Chebyshev roots have identical power sums for all powers j with 0 < j < N.
   558→
   559→Cases j ∈ {1,2,3} are proven above. The general case follows the same pattern.
   560→-/
   561→theorem powersum_general_equality (N j : ℕ) (hN : j < N) (hj : 0 < j) :
   562→    ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, (Real.cos (2 * π * k / N))^j =
   563→    ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, (Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)))^j := by
   564→  -- Strategy: Both sums can be evaluated using binomial expansion + roots of unity
   565→  -- For small j, we've proven this explicitly (j=1,2,3,4)
   566→  -- For general j, the same pattern holds: power reduction gives linear combinations of
   567→  -- cos(m·angle), and each such sum vanishes by roots of unity arguments when m≠0
   568→
   569→  -- Handle small cases explicitly
   570→  match j with
   571→  | 0 => omega  -- Contradicts hj : 0 < j
   572→  | 1 =>
   573→    simp only [pow_one]
   574→    exact powersum_j1_equality N (by omega)
   575→  | 2 => exact powersum_j2_equality N (by omega)
   576→  | 3 => exact powersum_j3_equality N (by omega)
   577→  | 4 => exact powersum_j4_equality N (by omega)
   578→  | _ =>
   579→    -- For j ≥ 5, use the general binomial expansion argument
   580→    -- Both sides equal a value that depends only on N and j (not on the specific angles)
   581→    -- This follows from the fact that for BOTH parametrizations:
   582→    -- 1. cos^j(θ) can be written as linear combination of cos(mθ) for m = -j,-j+2,...,j-2,j
   583→    -- 2. The sum ∑_k cos(m·angle_k) = 0 when m ≠ 0 (by roots of unity)
   584→    -- 3. Only the constant term survives, giving the same value for both
   585→
   586→    -- The explicit computation requires proving vanishing of many sums
   587→    -- For a complete proof, one would either:
   588→    -- (a) Prove each case j=5,6,7,... explicitly (mechanical but tedious), or
   589→    -- (b) Prove a general lemma about sums of cos((2k+1)π/(2N))^j matching the pattern
   590→
   591→    -- Here we use approach (a) implicitly by appealing to the θ-invariance theorem
   592→    -- The left side is ∑cos(0 + 2πk/N)^j, which by powerSumCos_invariant equals
   593→    -- ∑cos(θ + 2πk/N)^j for ANY θ
   594→
   595→    sorry -- Full proof requires either explicit verification of remaining cases
   596→          -- or a sophisticated general argument about the two root parametrizations
   597→
   598→end PowerSumEquality
   599→
   600→end
   601→

/-
Copyright (c) 2025 Eric. All rights reserved.
Released under Apache 2.0 license as described in the file LICENSE.
Authors: Eric
-/
import Mathlib.Algebra.BigOperators.Field
import ChebyshevCircles.RootsOfUnity
import ChebyshevCircles.TrigonometricIdentities
import ChebyshevCircles.ChebyshevRoots

set_option linter.style.longLine false

/-!
# Power Sum Equality

This section proves that both rotated roots of unity and Chebyshev roots have the same
power sums for j=1 and j=2. This is a key step in showing that the two polynomials
have identical coefficients (except for the constant term).

## Main results

* `rotated_roots_sum_eq_zero`: Sum of rotated roots of unity is 0 for N > 1
* `chebyshev_roots_sum_eq_zero`: Sum of Chebyshev roots is 0 for N > 1
* `powersum_j1_equality`: Both root systems have the same j=1 power sum
* `rotated_roots_sum_sq_eq`: Sum of squares of rotated roots equals N/2 for N > 2
* `chebyshev_roots_sum_sq_eq`: Sum of squares of Chebyshev roots equals N/2 for N > 2
* `powersum_j2_equality`: Both root systems have the same j=2 power sum

## Tags

power sums, Chebyshev polynomials, roots of unity
-/

noncomputable section

open Complex Real
open scoped BigOperators

section PowerSumEquality

/-- Sum of rotated roots of unity projected to reals is 0 for N > 1.
    Uses the fact that exp(2πi/N) is a primitive N-th root of unity. -/
lemma rotated_roots_sum_eq_zero (N : ℕ) (hN : 1 < N) :
    ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos (2 * π * k / N) = 0 := by
  have hN0 : N ≠ 0 := by omega
  have prim : IsPrimitiveRoot (exp (2 * π * I / ↑N)) N :=
    Complex.isPrimitiveRoot_exp N hN0
  have cos_eq : ∀ k : ℕ, Real.cos (2 * π * (k : ℝ) / N) = (exp (2 * π * I * k / N)).re := fun k => by
    have h1 : (2 * π * I * (k : ℂ) / N) = ((2 * π * (k : ℝ) / N : ℝ) : ℂ) * I := by
      push_cast
      ring
    rw [h1]
    exact (Complex.exp_ofReal_mul_I_re _).symm
  simp_rw [cos_eq]
  rw [← re_sum]
  have exp_eq : ∀ k : ℕ, exp (2 * π * I * (k : ℂ) / ↑N) = exp (2 * π * I / ↑N) ^ k := fun k => by
    rw [← Complex.exp_nat_mul]
    congr 1
    ring
  simp_rw [exp_eq]
  rw [prim.geom_sum_eq_zero hN]
  simp

/-- Sum of Chebyshev roots is 0 for N > 1.

Proof by pairing: cos((2k+1)π/(2N)) + cos((2(N-k-1)+1)π/(2N)) = 0
because the angles sum to π, and cos(θ) + cos(π-θ) = 0. -/
lemma chebyshev_roots_sum_eq_zero (N : ℕ) (hN : 1 < N) :
    ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) = 0 := by
  -- Use pairing symmetry: pair k with (N - k - 1)
  -- The angles (2k+1)π/(2N) and (2(N-k-1)+1)π/(2N) sum to π
  -- So cos(θ) + cos(π - θ) = 0 for each pair
  have key : ∀ k < N, Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) +
                      Real.cos ((2 * (N - k - 1) + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) = 0 := by
    intro k hk
    -- Show the angles sum to π
    have angle_sum : (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N) + (2 * (N - k - 1) + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N) = π := by
      field_simp
      ring_nf
    -- Use cos(θ) + cos(π - θ) = 0
    have second_angle : (2 * (N - k - 1) + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N) = π - (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N) := by
      linarith [angle_sum]
    rw [second_angle, Real.cos_pi_sub]
    ring
  -- Use involution: each k pairs with (N - k - 1), and they cancel
  let f : ℕ → ℝ := fun k => Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))
  change ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, f k = 0
  refine Finset.sum_involution (fun k _ => N - k - 1) ?_ ?_ ?_ ?_
  · -- Show f k + f (g k) = 0 for each k
    intro k hk
    have hk' : k < N := Finset.mem_range.mp hk
    change f k + f (N - k - 1) = 0
    simp only [f]
    -- Need to show ↑(N - k - 1) = ↑N - ↑k - 1
    have h_le : k + 1 ≤ N := Nat.succ_le_of_lt hk'
    have cast_eq : ((N - k - 1 : ℕ) : ℝ) = (N : ℝ) - (k : ℝ) - 1 := by
      rw [show N - k - 1 = N - (k + 1) by omega]
      rw [Nat.cast_sub h_le]
      push_cast
      ring
    rw [cast_eq]
    exact key k hk'
  · -- Show that non-zero elements map to different elements
    intro k hk hfk
    simp only [Finset.mem_range] at hk
    intro heq
    -- If N - k - 1 = k, then 2k + 1 = N, so f k = cos(π/2) = 0
    simp only [f] at hfk
    simp only at heq
    have h_eq : 2 * k + 1 = N := by omega
    have : (2 * (k : ℝ) + 1) * π / (2 * N) = π / 2 := by
      have : (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) = N := by norm_cast
      rw [this]
      field_simp
    rw [this, Real.cos_pi_div_two] at hfk
    exact hfk rfl
  · -- Show g k is in the range
    intro k hk
    simp only [Finset.mem_range] at hk ⊢
    have hk_lt : k < N := hk
    by_cases h : N - k - 1 < N
    · exact h
    · simp at h
      omega
  · -- Show g (g k) = k (involution)
    intro k hk
    simp only [Finset.mem_range] at hk
    have hk_lt : k < N := hk
    have h_le : k + 1 ≤ N := Nat.succ_le_of_lt hk_lt
    simp only
    -- Need to show: N - (N - k - 1) - 1 = k
    rw [show N - k - 1 = N - (k + 1) by omega]
    rw [Nat.sub_sub_self h_le]
    omega

/-- Power sum equality for j=1: both root systems sum to 0. -/
lemma powersum_j1_equality (N : ℕ) (hN : 1 < N) :
    ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos (2 * π * k / N) =
    ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) := by
  rw [rotated_roots_sum_eq_zero N hN, chebyshev_roots_sum_eq_zero N hN]

/-- Sum of cos²(2πk/N) equals N/2 for N > 2. -/
lemma rotated_roots_sum_sq_eq (N : ℕ) (hN : 2 < N) :
    ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, (Real.cos (2 * π * k / N)) ^ 2 = N / 2 := by
  -- Use cos²(x) = (1 + cos(2x))/2
  have cos_sq : ∀ x, Real.cos x ^ 2 = (1 + Real.cos (2 * x)) / 2 := by
    intro x
    rw [Real.cos_sq]
    ring
  simp_rw [cos_sq]
  rw [← Finset.sum_div]
  rw [Finset.sum_add_distrib, Finset.sum_const, Finset.card_range]
  -- Show ∑cos(4πk/N) = 0
  have sum_zero : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos (2 * (2 * π * k / N)) = 0 := by
    calc ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos (2 * (2 * π * k / N))
        = ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos (4 * π * k / N) := by
          congr 1; ext k
          ring_nf
      _ = 0 := by
          -- Use sum_cos_multiple_rotated_roots with m=2, requires 2 < N
          have h := sum_cos_multiple_rotated_roots N 2 0 (by omega : 0 < N) (by omega : 0 < 2) (by omega : 2 < N)
          convert h using 2 with k
          simp
          ring_nf
  rw [sum_zero]
  ring

/-- Sum of cos²((2k+1)π/(2N)) equals N/2 for N > 2. -/
lemma chebyshev_roots_sum_sq_eq (N : ℕ) (hN : 2 < N) :
    ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, (Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))) ^ 2 = N / 2 := by
  -- Use cos²(x) = (1 + cos(2x))/2
  have cos_sq : ∀ x, Real.cos x ^ 2 = (1 + Real.cos (2 * x)) / 2 := by
    intro x
    rw [Real.cos_sq]
    ring
  simp_rw [cos_sq]
  rw [← Finset.sum_div]
  rw [Finset.sum_add_distrib, Finset.sum_const, Finset.card_range]
  -- Show ∑cos((2k+1)π/N) = 0 using pairing
  have sum_zero : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos (2 * ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))) = 0 := by
    have simplified : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos (2 * ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))) =
                      ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / N) := by
      congr 1
      ext k
      ring_nf
    rw [simplified]
    have complex_sum : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Complex.exp (Complex.I * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / N) = 0 := by
      calc ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Complex.exp (Complex.I * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / N)
          = ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Complex.exp (Complex.I * π / N) * Complex.exp (Complex.I * (2 * k : ℝ) * π / N) := by
            congr 1
            ext k
            rw [← Complex.exp_add]
            congr 1
            push_cast
            ring
        _ = Complex.exp (Complex.I * π / N) * ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Complex.exp (Complex.I * (2 * k : ℝ) * π / N) := by
            rw [Finset.mul_sum]
        _ = Complex.exp (Complex.I * π / N) * ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Complex.exp (2 * (Complex.I * π * k / N)) := by
            congr 2
            ext k
            congr 1
            push_cast
            ring
        _ = Complex.exp (Complex.I * π / N) * 0 := by
            congr 1
            -- Use primitive roots of unity
            have prim : IsPrimitiveRoot (Complex.exp (2 * π * Complex.I / N)) N := by
              apply Complex.isPrimitiveRoot_exp
              omega
            have geom := prim.geom_sum_eq_zero (by omega : 1 < N)
            convert geom using 2 with k
            rw [← Complex.exp_nat_mul]
            congr 1
            ring
        _ = 0 := by simp
    -- Extract real part: the sum of cosines equals Re(sum of complex exponentials)
    have cos_eq : ∀ k : ℕ, Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / N) = (exp (I * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / N)).re := fun k => by
      have h1 : (I * ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) : ℂ) * π / N) = (((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / N : ℝ) : ℂ) * I := by
        push_cast
        ring
      rw [show (I * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / N : ℂ) = I * ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) : ℂ) * π / N by push_cast; rfl]
      rw [h1]
      exact (Complex.exp_ofReal_mul_I_re _).symm
    simp_rw [cos_eq]
    rw [← Complex.re_sum, complex_sum]
    simp
  rw [sum_zero]
  ring

/-- Power sum equality for j=2: both root systems sum to N/2. -/
lemma powersum_j2_equality (N : ℕ) (hN : 2 < N) :
    ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, (Real.cos (2 * π * k / N)) ^ 2 =
    ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, (Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))) ^ 2 := by
  rw [rotated_roots_sum_sq_eq N hN, chebyshev_roots_sum_sq_eq N hN]

/-- Sum of cos³(2πk/N) equals 0 for N > 3. -/
lemma rotated_roots_sum_cube_eq (N : ℕ) (hN : 3 < N) :
    ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, (Real.cos (2 * π * k / N)) ^ 3 = 0 := by
  -- Use cos³(x) = (cos(3x) + 3cos(x))/4
  have cos_cube : ∀ x, Real.cos x ^ 3 = (Real.cos (3 * x) + 3 * Real.cos x) / 4 :=
    cos_cube_formula
  simp_rw [cos_cube]
  rw [← Finset.sum_div]
  rw [Finset.sum_add_distrib]
  -- Show ∑cos(6πk/N) = 0
  have sum_cos3 : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos (3 * (2 * π * k / N)) = 0 := by
    calc ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos (3 * (2 * π * k / N))
        = ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos (6 * π * k / N) := by
          congr 1; ext k
          ring_nf
      _ = 0 := by
          have h := sum_cos_multiple_rotated_roots N 3 0 (by omega : 0 < N) (by omega : 0 < 3) (by omega : 3 < N)
          convert h using 2 with k
          simp
          ring_nf
  -- Show ∑3cos(2πk/N) = 0 using j=1
  have sum_cos : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, 3 * Real.cos (2 * π * k / N) = 0 := by
    have : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, 3 * Real.cos (2 * π * k / N) =
           3 * ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos (2 * π * k / N) := by
      rw [Finset.mul_sum]
    rw [this]
    have : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos (2 * π * k / N) = 0 :=
      rotated_roots_sum_eq_zero N (by omega : 1 < N)
    rw [this]
    ring
  rw [sum_cos3, sum_cos]
  ring

/-- Sum of cos³((2k+1)π/(2N)) equals 0 for N > 3. -/
lemma chebyshev_roots_sum_cube_eq (N : ℕ) (hN : 3 < N) :
    ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, (Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))) ^ 3 = 0 := by
  -- Use cos³(x) = (cos(3x) + 3cos(x))/4
  have cos_cube : ∀ x, Real.cos x ^ 3 = (Real.cos (3 * x) + 3 * Real.cos x) / 4 :=
    cos_cube_formula
  simp_rw [cos_cube]
  rw [← Finset.sum_div]
  rw [Finset.sum_add_distrib]
  -- Show ∑cos(3(2k+1)π/(2N)) = 0
  have sum_cos3 : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos (3 * ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))) = 0 := by
    have simplified : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos (3 * ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))) =
                      ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos ((6 * k + 3 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) := by
      congr 1
      ext k
      ring_nf
    rw [simplified]
    -- Use pairing: angles at k and (N-k-1) sum to 3π, so cosines cancel
    -- cos((6k+3)π/(2N)) + cos((6(N-k-1)+3)π/(2N)) = cos(θ) + cos(3π-θ) = 0
    have key : ∀ k < N, Real.cos ((6 * k + 3 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) +
                        Real.cos ((6 * (N - k - 1) + 3 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) = 0 := by
      intro k hk
      -- Show the angles sum to 3π
      have angle_sum : (6 * k + 3 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N) + (6 * (N - k - 1) + 3 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N) = 3 * π := by
        field_simp
        ring
      -- Use cos(θ) + cos(3π - θ) = 0
      have second_angle : (6 * (N - k - 1) + 3 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N) =
                          3 * π - (6 * k + 3 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N) := by
        linarith [angle_sum]
      rw [second_angle]
      -- cos(3π - θ) = cos(3π)cos(θ) + sin(3π)sin(θ) = (-1)cos(θ) + 0·sin(θ) = -cos(θ)
      have : Real.cos (3 * π - (6 * k + 3 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) = -Real.cos ((6 * k + 3 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) := by
        rw [Real.cos_sub]
        have cos_3pi : Real.cos (3 * π) = -1 := by
          rw [show (3 : ℝ) * π = 2 * π + π by ring]
          rw [Real.cos_add]
          norm_num [Real.cos_two_pi, Real.sin_two_pi, Real.cos_pi, Real.sin_pi]
        have sin_3pi : Real.sin (3 * π) = 0 := by
          rw [show (3 : ℝ) * π = 2 * π + π by ring]
          rw [Real.sin_add]
          norm_num [Real.cos_two_pi, Real.sin_two_pi, Real.cos_pi, Real.sin_pi]
        rw [cos_3pi, sin_3pi]
        ring
      rw [this]
      ring
    -- Use involution pairing
    let f : ℕ → ℝ := fun k => Real.cos ((6 * k + 3 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))
    change ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, f k = 0
    refine Finset.sum_involution (fun k _ => N - k - 1) ?_ ?_ ?_ ?_
    · -- Show f k + f (g k) = 0
      intro k hk
      have hk' : k < N := Finset.mem_range.mp hk
      change f k + f (N - k - 1) = 0
      simp only [f]
      -- Need to show ↑(N - k - 1) = ↑N - ↑k - 1
      have h_le : k + 1 ≤ N := Nat.succ_le_of_lt hk'
      have cast_eq : ((N - k - 1 : ℕ) : ℝ) = (N : ℝ) - (k : ℝ) - 1 := by
        rw [show N - k - 1 = N - (k + 1) by omega]
        rw [Nat.cast_sub h_le]
        push_cast
        ring
      rw [cast_eq]
      exact key k hk'
    · -- Show that non-zero elements map to different elements
      intro k hk hfk
      simp only [Finset.mem_range] at hk
      intro heq
      simp only [f] at hfk
      simp only at heq
      -- If N - k - 1 = k, then f k + f k = 0, so f k = 0
      -- This happens when 2k + 1 = N
      have h_eq : 2 * k + 1 = N := by omega
      -- Then (6k+3)π/(2N) = 3(2k+1)π/(2N) = 3π/2
      have : (6 * k + 3 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N) = 3 * π / 2 := by
        have : (6 * k + 3 : ℝ) = 3 * N := by norm_cast; omega
        rw [this]
        field_simp
      -- cos(3π/2) = 0 because 3π/2 = π + π/2, so cos(3π/2) = -cos(π/2) = 0
      have cos_val : Real.cos (3 * π / 2) = 0 := by
        rw [show (3 : ℝ) * π / 2 = π + π / 2 by ring]
        rw [Real.cos_add]
        norm_num [Real.cos_pi, Real.sin_pi, Real.cos_pi_div_two, Real.sin_pi_div_two]
      rw [this, cos_val] at hfk
      exact hfk rfl
    · -- Show g k is in range
      intro k hk
      simp only [Finset.mem_range] at hk ⊢
      omega
    · -- Show g (g k) = k (involution)
      intro k hk
      simp only [Finset.mem_range] at hk
      -- Need: N - (N - k - 1) - 1 = k
      have hk_lt : k < N := hk
      have h_le : k + 1 ≤ N := Nat.succ_le_of_lt hk_lt
      simp only
      rw [show N - k - 1 = N - (k + 1) by omega]
      have h_le2 : N - (k + 1) + 1 ≤ N := by omega
      rw [Nat.sub_sub_self h_le]
      omega
  -- Show ∑3cos((2k+1)π/(2N)) = 0 using j=1
  have sum_cos : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, 3 * Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) = 0 := by
    have : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, 3 * Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) =
           3 * ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) := by
      rw [← Finset.mul_sum]
    rw [this]
    have : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)) = 0 :=
      chebyshev_roots_sum_eq_zero N (by omega : 1 < N)
    rw [this]
    ring
  rw [sum_cos3, sum_cos]
  ring

/-- Power sum equality for j=3: both root systems sum to 0. -/
lemma powersum_j3_equality (N : ℕ) (hN : 3 < N) :
    ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, (Real.cos (2 * π * k / N)) ^ 3 =
    ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, (Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))) ^ 3 := by
  rw [rotated_roots_sum_cube_eq N hN, chebyshev_roots_sum_cube_eq N hN]

/-- Sum of cos⁴(2πk/N) equals 3N/8 for N > 4. -/
lemma rotated_roots_sum_fourth_power_eq (N : ℕ) (hN : 4 < N) :
    ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, (Real.cos (2 * π * k / N)) ^ 4 = 3 * N / 8 := by
  -- Use cos⁴(x) = (3 + 4cos(2x) + cos(4x))/8
  have cos_four : ∀ x, Real.cos x ^ 4 = (3 + 4 * Real.cos (2 * x) + Real.cos (4 * x)) / 8 :=
    cos_four_formula
  simp_rw [cos_four]
  rw [← Finset.sum_div]
  rw [Finset.sum_add_distrib, Finset.sum_add_distrib]
  -- Constant term: ∑ 3/8 = 3N/8
  have h_const : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, (3 : ℝ) = 3 * N := by
    simp [Finset.sum_const, Finset.card_range]
    ring
  -- Sum ∑cos(4πk/N) = 0
  have sum_2x : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, 4 * Real.cos (2 * (2 * π * k / N)) = 0 := by
    have h := sum_cos_multiple_rotated_roots N 2 0 (by omega) (by omega) (by omega)
    have : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos (2 * (2 * π * k / N)) = 0 := by
      convert h using 2 with k
      simp only [zero_add]
      norm_num
    rw [← Finset.mul_sum, this]; ring
  -- Sum ∑cos(8πk/N) = 0
  have sum_4x : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos (4 * (2 * π * k / N)) = 0 := by
    have h := sum_cos_multiple_rotated_roots N 4 0 (by omega) (by omega) (by omega)
    convert h using 2 with k
    simp only [zero_add]
    norm_num
  rw [h_const, sum_2x, sum_4x]
  ring

/-- Sum of cos⁴((2k+1)π/(2N)) equals 3N/8 for N > 4. -/
lemma chebyshev_roots_sum_fourth_power_eq (N : ℕ) (hN : 4 < N) :
    ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, (Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))) ^ 4 = 3 * N / 8 := by
  -- Use the same power reduction formula
  have cos_four : ∀ x, Real.cos x ^ 4 = (3 + 4 * Real.cos (2 * x) + Real.cos (4 * x)) / 8 :=
    cos_four_formula
  simp_rw [cos_four]
  rw [← Finset.sum_div]
  rw [Finset.sum_add_distrib, Finset.sum_add_distrib]
  -- Constant term
  have h_const : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, (3 : ℝ) = 3 * N := by
    simp [Finset.sum_const, Finset.card_range]; ring
  -- Non-constant terms vanish (similar to j=2,3 proofs)
  have sum_2x : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, 4 * Real.cos (2 * ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))) = 0 := by
    rw [← Finset.mul_sum]
    have simplified : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos (2 * ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))) =
                      ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / N) := by
      congr 1; ext k; ring_nf
    rw [simplified]
    have complex_sum : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Complex.exp (Complex.I * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / N) = 0 := by
      calc ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Complex.exp (Complex.I * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / N)
          = ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Complex.exp (Complex.I * π / N) * Complex.exp (Complex.I * (2 * k : ℝ) * π / N) := by
            congr 1; ext k; rw [← Complex.exp_add]; congr 1; push_cast; ring
        _ = Complex.exp (Complex.I * π / N) * ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Complex.exp (Complex.I * (2 * k : ℝ) * π / N) := by
            rw [Finset.mul_sum]
        _ = Complex.exp (Complex.I * π / N) * ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Complex.exp (2 * (Complex.I * π * k / N)) := by
            congr 2; ext k; congr 1; push_cast; ring
        _ = Complex.exp (Complex.I * π / N) * 0 := by
            congr 1
            have prim : IsPrimitiveRoot (Complex.exp (2 * π * Complex.I / N)) N := by
              apply Complex.isPrimitiveRoot_exp; omega
            have geom := prim.geom_sum_eq_zero (by omega : 1 < N)
            convert geom using 2 with k
            rw [← Complex.exp_nat_mul]; congr 1; ring
        _ = 0 := by simp
    have cos_eq : ∀ k : ℕ, Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / N) = (Complex.exp (Complex.I * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / N)).re := fun k => by
      have h1 : (Complex.I * ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) : ℂ) * π / N) = (((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / N : ℝ) : ℂ) * Complex.I := by
        push_cast; ring
      rw [show (Complex.I * (2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / N : ℂ) = Complex.I * ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) : ℂ) * π / N by push_cast; rfl]
      rw [h1]
      exact (Complex.exp_ofReal_mul_I_re _).symm
    simp_rw [cos_eq]
    rw [← Complex.re_sum, complex_sum]; simp
  have sum_4x : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos (4 * ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))) = 0 := by
    -- Simplify: 4 * ((2k+1)π/(2N)) = (4k+2)π/N
    -- This is exactly the same pattern as sum_2x: ∑ exp(I·(4k+2)π/N) = 0
    have simplified : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos (4 * ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))) =
                      ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos ((4 * k + 2 : ℝ) * π / N) := by
      congr 1; ext k; ring_nf
    rw [simplified]
    -- Same technique as in the j=2 proof (lines 187-226)
    have complex_sum : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Complex.exp (Complex.I * (4 * k + 2 : ℝ) * π / N) = 0 := by
      calc ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Complex.exp (Complex.I * (4 * k + 2 : ℝ) * π / N)
          = ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Complex.exp (Complex.I * 2 * π / N) * Complex.exp (Complex.I * (4 * k : ℝ) * π / N) := by
            congr 1; ext k; rw [← Complex.exp_add]; congr 1; push_cast; ring
        _ = Complex.exp (Complex.I * 2 * π / N) * ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Complex.exp (Complex.I * (4 * k : ℝ) * π / N) := by
            rw [Finset.mul_sum]
        _ = Complex.exp (Complex.I * 2 * π / N) * ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Complex.exp (4 * (Complex.I * π * k / N)) := by
            congr 2; ext k; congr 1; push_cast; ring
        _ = Complex.exp (Complex.I * 2 * π / N) * 0 := by
            congr 1
            -- ∑ exp(4πik/N) = ∑ (exp(4πi/N))^k
            -- exp(4πi/N) has order N/gcd(N,2) which is > 1 when N > 4
            let ω := Complex.exp (4 * π * Complex.I / N)
            have exp_pow : ∀ k : ℕ, Complex.exp (4 * (Complex.I * π * k / N)) = ω ^ k := fun k => by
              simp only [ω]
              rw [← Complex.exp_nat_mul]
              congr 1
              field_simp
            simp_rw [exp_pow]
            -- ω = exp(4πi/N) = (exp(2πi/N))^2
            have prim : IsPrimitiveRoot (Complex.exp (2 * π * Complex.I / N)) N := by
              apply Complex.isPrimitiveRoot_exp; omega
            have ω_eq : ω = (Complex.exp (2 * π * Complex.I / N)) ^ 2 := by
              simp only [ω]
              rw [← Complex.exp_nat_mul]
              congr 1
              push_cast
              ring
            -- Use primitive root property
            rw [ω_eq]
            by_cases h : Even N
            · obtain ⟨m, rfl⟩ := h
              have hm : 2 < m := by omega
              -- When N = 2m, (exp(2πi/N))^2 = exp(4πi/(2m)) = exp(2πi/m) is a primitive m-th root
              -- The sum goes through the m-th roots twice
              have prim_m : IsPrimitiveRoot (Complex.exp (2 * π * Complex.I / m)) m := by
                apply Complex.isPrimitiveRoot_exp
                omega
              -- Normalize the casting and simplify the base of the exponential
              suffices h_suff : ∑ x ∈ Finset.range (m + m), (Complex.exp (2 * π * Complex.I / m)) ^ x = 0 by
                convert h_suff using 2
                simp only [← Complex.exp_nat_mul]
                congr 1
                push_cast
                field_simp
                ring
              -- Split the sum: ∑_{x=0}^{2m-1} = ∑_{x=0}^{m-1} + ∑_{x=m}^{2m-1}
              rw [Finset.sum_range_add]
              -- The second sum equals the first because ζ^m = 1
              have pow_m : (Complex.exp (2 * π * Complex.I / m)) ^ m = 1 := prim_m.pow_eq_one
              have sum_shift : ∑ x ∈ Finset.range m, (Complex.exp (2 * π * Complex.I / m)) ^ (m + x) =
                              ∑ x ∈ Finset.range m, (Complex.exp (2 * π * Complex.I / m)) ^ x := by
                congr 1
                ext x
                rw [pow_add, pow_m, one_mul]
              rw [sum_shift, ← two_mul, mul_comm]
              simp [prim_m.geom_sum_eq_zero (by omega : 1 < m)]
            · -- N odd: (exp(2πi/N))^2 is primitive since gcd(2,N) = 1
              have prim2 : IsPrimitiveRoot ((Complex.exp (2 * π * Complex.I / N)) ^ 2) N := by
                apply IsPrimitiveRoot.pow_of_coprime prim
                rw [Nat.Prime.coprime_iff_not_dvd Nat.prime_two]
                intro h_dvd
                have h_eq : N = 2 * (N / 2) := Nat.eq_mul_of_div_eq_right h_dvd rfl
                rw [Nat.two_mul] at h_eq
                exact h ⟨N / 2, h_eq⟩
              exact prim2.geom_sum_eq_zero (by omega : 1 < N)
        _ = 0 := by simp
    -- Extract real part
    have cos_eq : ∀ k : ℕ, Real.cos ((4 * k + 2 : ℝ) * π / N) = (Complex.exp (Complex.I * (4 * k + 2 : ℝ) * π / N)).re := fun k => by
      have h1 : (Complex.I * ((4 * k + 2 : ℝ) : ℂ) * π / N) = (((4 * k + 2 : ℝ) * π / N : ℝ) : ℂ) * Complex.I := by
        push_cast; ring
      rw [show (Complex.I * (4 * k + 2 : ℝ) * π / N : ℂ) = Complex.I * ((4 * k + 2 : ℝ) : ℂ) * π / N by push_cast; rfl]
      rw [h1]
      exact (Complex.exp_ofReal_mul_I_re _).symm
    simp_rw [cos_eq]
    rw [← Complex.re_sum, complex_sum]; simp
  rw [h_const, sum_2x, sum_4x]
  ring

/-- Power sum equality for j=4: both root systems sum to 3N/8. -/
lemma powersum_j4_equality (N : ℕ) (hN : 4 < N) :
    ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, (Real.cos (2 * π * k / N)) ^ 4 =
    ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, (Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N))) ^ 4 := by
  rw [rotated_roots_sum_fourth_power_eq N hN, chebyshev_roots_sum_fourth_power_eq N hN]

/-- General power sum equality for all j < N.

This theorem states that the rotated roots of unity (projected to real axis) and the
Chebyshev roots have identical power sums for all powers j with 0 < j < N.

Cases j ∈ {1,2,3} are proven above. The general case follows the same pattern.
-/
theorem powersum_general_equality (N j : ℕ) (hN : j < N) (hj : 0 < j) :
    ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, (Real.cos (2 * π * k / N))^j =
    ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, (Real.cos ((2 * k + 1 : ℝ) * π / (2 * N)))^j := by
  -- Strategy: Both sums can be evaluated using binomial expansion + roots of unity
  -- For small j, we've proven this explicitly (j=1,2,3,4)
  -- For general j, the same pattern holds: power reduction gives linear combinations of
  -- cos(m·angle), and each such sum vanishes by roots of unity arguments when m≠0

  -- Handle small cases explicitly
  match j with
  | 0 => omega  -- Contradicts hj : 0 < j
  | 1 =>
    simp only [pow_one]
    exact powersum_j1_equality N (by omega)
  | 2 => exact powersum_j2_equality N (by omega)
  | 3 => exact powersum_j3_equality N (by omega)
  | 4 => exact powersum_j4_equality N (by omega)
  | _ =>
    -- For j ≥ 5, use the general binomial expansion argument
    -- Both sides equal a value that depends only on N and j (not on the specific angles)
    -- This follows from the fact that for BOTH parametrizations:
    -- 1. cos^j(θ) can be written as linear combination of cos(mθ) for m = -j,-j+2,...,j-2,j
    -- 2. The sum ∑_k cos(m·angle_k) = 0 when m ≠ 0 (by roots of unity)
    -- 3. Only the constant term survives, giving the same value for both

    -- The explicit computation requires proving vanishing of many sums
    -- For a complete proof, one would either:
    -- (a) Prove each case j=5,6,7,... explicitly (mechanical but tedious), or
    -- (b) Prove a general lemma about sums of cos((2k+1)π/(2N))^j matching the pattern

    -- Here we use approach (a) implicitly by appealing to the θ-invariance theorem
    -- The left side is ∑cos(0 + 2πk/N)^j, which by powerSumCos_invariant equals
    -- ∑cos(θ + 2πk/N)^j for ANY θ

    sorry -- Full proof requires either explicit verification of remaining cases
          -- or a sophisticated general argument about the two root parametrizations

end PowerSumEquality

end

/-
Copyright (c) 2025 Eric. All rights reserved.
Released under Apache 2.0 license as described in the file LICENSE.
Authors: Eric
-/
import Mathlib.Analysis.SpecialFunctions.Trigonometric.Basic
import Mathlib.RingTheory.RootsOfUnity.Basic
import Mathlib.Analysis.Complex.Exponential
import Mathlib.Algebra.Ring.Basic
import Mathlib.NumberTheory.Cyclotomic.PrimitiveRoots

/-!
# Trigonometric Identities and Sums

Fundamental lemmas about sums of cosines at equally-spaced angles. These leverage the
geometric sum formulas for primitive roots of unity to show that most trigonometric sums
vanish, which is key to proving the θ-invariance of power sums.

## Main results

* `sum_cos_roots_of_unity`: Sum of N equally spaced cosines equals zero for N ≥ 2
* `sum_cos_multiple_rotated_roots`: Sum of cos at multiples vanishes for 0 < m < N
* `cos_cube_formula`: Power reduction formula for cos³(x)
* `list_foldr_eq_multiset_prod`: Helper for polynomial construction

## Tags

trigonometry, roots of unity, geometric sums
-/

noncomputable section

open Polynomial Real Complex
open scoped Polynomial

/-- Sum of cosines at N equally spaced angles equals zero for N ≥ 2. -/
lemma sum_cos_roots_of_unity (N : ℕ) (θ : ℝ) (hN : 2 ≤ N) :
    ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos (θ + 2 * π * k / N) = 0 := by
  conv_lhs =>
    arg 2
    ext k
    rw [← Complex.exp_ofReal_mul_I_re (θ + 2 * π * k / N)]
  rw [← Complex.re_sum]
  simp only [Complex.ofReal_add, Complex.ofReal_mul, Complex.ofReal_div, Complex.ofReal_natCast]
  conv_lhs =>
    arg 1
    arg 2
    ext k
    rw [add_mul, Complex.exp_add]
  rw [← Finset.mul_sum]
  have hN' : N ≠ 0 := by omega
  let ζ := Complex.exp (2 * π * I / N)
  have hζ : IsPrimitiveRoot ζ N := Complex.isPrimitiveRoot_exp N hN'
  have geom_sum : ∑ i ∈ Finset.range N, ζ ^ i = 0 := hζ.geom_sum_eq_zero (by omega : 1 < N)
  suffices ∑ i ∈ Finset.range N, Complex.exp (↑2 * ↑π * ↑i / ↑N * I) = 0 by
    simp [this]
  calc ∑ i ∈ Finset.range N, Complex.exp (↑2 * ↑π * ↑i / ↑N * I)
      = ∑ i ∈ Finset.range N, ζ ^ i := by
        congr 1 with i
        simp only [ζ]
        rw [← Complex.exp_nat_mul]
        congr 1
        field_simp
    _ = 0 := geom_sum

/-- List.foldr for polynomial construction equals Multiset.prod. -/
lemma list_foldr_eq_multiset_prod (l : List ℝ) :
    List.foldr (fun r p => (X - C r) * p) 1 l =
    (Multiset.map (fun r => X - C r) (l : Multiset ℝ)).prod := by
  induction l with
  | nil =>
    simp [Multiset.map_zero]
  | cons head tail ih =>
    simp only [List.foldr]
    have h_coe : ((head :: tail) : Multiset ℝ) = head ::ₘ (tail : Multiset ℝ) := rfl
    rw [h_coe]
    simp only [Multiset.map_cons, Multiset.prod_cons]
    rw [ih]

/-- For 0 < m < N, the sum ∑_{k=0}^{N-1} cos(m(θ + 2πk/N)) = 0. -/
lemma sum_cos_multiple_rotated_roots (N : ℕ) (m : ℕ) (θ : ℝ)
    (hN : 0 < N) (hm : 0 < m) (hm' : m < N) :
    ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, Real.cos (m * (θ + 2 * π * k / N)) = 0 := by
  conv_lhs =>
    arg 2
    ext k
    rw [← Complex.exp_ofReal_mul_I_re (m * (θ + 2 * π * k / N))]
  rw [← Complex.re_sum]
  simp only [Complex.ofReal_mul, Complex.ofReal_add, Complex.ofReal_div, Complex.ofReal_natCast]
  have hN' : N ≠ 0 := Nat.pos_iff_ne_zero.mp hN
  let ζ := Complex.exp (2 * π * I / N)
  have hζ : IsPrimitiveRoot ζ N := Complex.isPrimitiveRoot_exp N hN'
  suffices h_sum_zero : ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, cexp (↑m * (↑2 * ↑π * ↑k / ↑N) * I) = 0 by
    simp only [mul_add, add_mul]
    conv_lhs =>
      arg 1
      arg 2
      ext x
      rw [Complex.exp_add]
    rw [← Finset.mul_sum]
    have : ∑ i ∈ Finset.range N, cexp (↑m * (↑2 * ↑π * ↑i / ↑N) * I) = 0 := h_sum_zero
    simp [this]
  calc ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, cexp (↑m * (↑2 * ↑π * ↑k / ↑N) * I)
      = ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, ζ ^ (m * k) := by
        congr 1 with k
        simp only [ζ]
        rw [← Complex.exp_nat_mul]
        congr 1
        field_simp
        norm_cast
    _ = ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, (ζ ^ m) ^ k := by
        congr 1 with k
        rw [← pow_mul]
    _ = 0 := by
        have h_ne_one : ζ ^ m ≠ 1 := by
          intro h_eq
          have h_div : N ∣ m := by
            have := hζ.pow_eq_one_iff_dvd m
            exact this.mp h_eq
          have : N ≤ m := Nat.le_of_dvd (by omega) h_div
          omega
        have h_pow_N : (ζ ^ m) ^ N = 1 := by
          rw [← pow_mul, mul_comm m N, pow_mul]
          simp [hζ.pow_eq_one]
        have h_geom : (ζ ^ m - 1) * ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, (ζ ^ m) ^ k = (ζ ^ m) ^ N - 1 :=
          mul_geom_sum (ζ ^ m) N
        rw [h_pow_N] at h_geom
        have : (ζ ^ m - 1) * ∑ k ∈ Finset.range N, (ζ ^ m) ^ k = 0 := by
          rw [h_geom]; ring
        exact eq_zero_of_ne_zero_of_mul_left_eq_zero (sub_ne_zero_of_ne h_ne_one) this

/-- cos³(x) in terms of cos(3x) and cos(x). -/
lemma cos_cube_formula (x : ℝ) :
    Real.cos x ^ 3 = (Real.cos (3 * x) + 3 * Real.cos x) / 4 := by
  have h := Real.cos_three_mul x
  have h1 : 4 * Real.cos x ^ 3 = Real.cos (3 * x) + 3 * Real.cos x := by linarith
  have h2 : Real.cos x ^ 3 = (Real.cos (3 * x) + 3 * Real.cos x) / 4 := by linarith
  exact h2

end
